sen.j: 神宮式年遷宮（じんぐう しきねん せんぐう）は神宮（伊勢神宮）の式年遷宮のことである。
sen.e: Jingu shikinen Sengu is Ise-Jigu Shrine's Shikinen Sengu.
Jingu Shikinen Sengu is the Shikinen Sengu at Ise-Jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました. This may need English clarification, such as '(rebuilding of shrine structures)'.
sen.e: Jingu Shikinen Sengu is the Shikinen Sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a prescribed number of years) at Jingu (Ise-Jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: Jingu (Ise-Jingu Shrine) としました。式年遷宮の説明も記載しました。

sen.j: 神宮では、20年ごとに皇大神宮・豊受大神宮の正殿など正宮・別宮の全ての社殿と鳥居を建て替え、御装束・神宝も造り替え神体を遷す。
sen.e: In Jingu, every 20 years, it reconstructs all Shaden (the buildings) and Torii of Shogu (the supreme two shrines) and Betsugu (second ranked affiliated shrines) including Kotai-jingu Shrine and Toyouke-taijingu Shrine, as well as renews Onshozoku (the sacred apparel) and Shinpo (the treasures), and carries them to the new site along with the symbol of the kami (deities).

In Jingu, every 20 years all Shaden (the buildings), the Torii of Shogu (the supreme two shrines) and Betsugu (second ranked affiliated shrines) including Kotai-jingu Shrine and Toyouke-taijingu Shrine are rebuilt, and the Onshozoku (the sacred apparel) and Shinpo (the treasures) are remade, and they are carried to a new site along with the symbol of the kami (deities).
sen.cmt: Rewritten to make the sentence passive - in the original sentence it is unclear what 'it' is referring to.
sen.e: In Jingu, every ２０ years all Shaden (the buildings) and the Torii (an archway to a Shinto shrine) of Shogu (the supreme two shrines) and Betsugu (second ranked affiliated shrines) including Kotai-jingu Shrine and Toyouke-Daijingu Shrine are rebuilt, and the Onshozoku (the sacred apparel) and Shinpo (the treasures) are remade, and they are carried to a new site along with the symbol of the kami (deities).
sen.cmt: 鳥居の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 明治から昭和初期には同時に、太平洋戦争以降は式年遷宮の4年前に宇治橋が架け替えられるようになった。
sen.e: Uji-bashi Bridge had been reconstructed on the same occasion during the period from Meiji to the early Showa, and after the Pacific War, it has been rebuilt four years before Shikinen Sengu.
Uji-bashi Bridge was also reconstructed at the same time from the Meiji to early Showa period, but since the Pacific War, it has been rebuilt four years before Shikinen Sengu.
Uji-bashi Bridge was also reconstructed at the same time from the Meiji to early Showa period, but since the Pacific War, it has been rebuilt four years before Shikinen Sengu.

sen.j: 690年の持統天皇の御代に始まり、戦国時代などの中断期を除き、1993年の第61回式年遷宮まで連綿と20年ごと（一部延期などあり）に続けられてきている。
sen.e: The first Shikinen Sengu was performed in 690, the period of Empress Jito, and since then, with only a few exceptions such as Sengoku Period, this system has continued conducting once in every 20 years (there were some postponements), and the 61st Shikinen Sengu was conducted in 1993.

The first Shikinen Sengu was performed in 690, in the time of Empress Jito, and since then, with only a few exceptions such as during the Sengoku Period, has been conducted once every 20 years (there were some postponements), and the 61st Shikinen Sengu was conducted in 1993.
sen.cmt: 「the period of」→「in the time of」, 「during the」挿入,「this system has continued conducting once in」→「has been conducted once」
sen.e: The first Shikinen Sengu was performed in 690, in the time of Empress Jito, and since then, with only a few exceptions such as during the Sengoku period (period of warring states), has been conducted once every 20 years (there were some postponements), and the 61st Shikinen Sengu was conducted in 1993.
sen.cmt: 戦国時代の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 2005年から第62回式年遷宮の各行事が進行中で、2013年には正遷宮（神体の渡御）が予定されている。
sen.e: Ceremonies for the 62th Sinkinen Sengu have been performed since 2005, and Seisengu (transfer of the symbol of the kami) is scheduled for 2013
Ceremonies for the 62nd Shikinen Sengu have been performed since 2005, and the Seisengu (transfer of the symbol of the kami) is scheduled for 2013
Ceremonies for the 62nd Shikinen Sengu have been performed since 2005, and the Seisengu (transfer of the symbol of the kami) is scheduled for 2013

tit.e: Significance of Sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building)
tit.cmt: 遷宮の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 遷宮を行う理由としては、建物が老朽化し、建替えが必要であるということである。
sen.e: Sengu is conducted because the buildings need reconstruction for getting old.
The Sengu is conducted because the buildings need reconstructing as they get old.
sen.cmt: 「The」挿入,「reconstruction for getting」→「reconstructing as they get」
sen.e: The Sengu is conducted because the buildings need reconstructing as they get old.

sen.j: 白木の掘立柱、萱葺屋根では、長持ちはしない。
sen.e: Hottatebashira (the pillars) of plain wood and thached roofs do not last long.
Plain wood hottatebashira (pillars) and thatched roofs do not last long.
Plain wood hottatebashira (pillars) and thatched roofs do not last long.

sen.j: しかし、式年遷宮の制度が定められた天武朝の前後には、創建（または再建）当時の建物が現存する法隆寺が建築されている。
sen.e: However, in Tenmucho (the period of Emperor Tenmu) when the system of Shikinen Sengu was established, Horyu-ji Temle, of which original or rebuilt structures exist, was built.
However, in Tenmucho (the period of Emperor Tenmu) when the system of Shikinen Sengu was established, Horyu-ji Temple, of which original and rebuilt structures exist, was built.
However, in Tenmucho (the period of Emperor Tenmu) when the system of Shikinen Sengu was established, Horyu-ji Temple, of which original and rebuilt structures exist, was built.

sen.j: 当時の国力・技術をもってすれば、神宮も現在にも残る建物にすることは可能であったと思われる。
sen.e: The national strength and the technology at that time would have been able to build Jingu buildings that would have survived to date.
Considering the national strength and the level of technological development at that time it would have been possible to build Jingu structures that survived to date.
Considering the national strength and the level of technological development at that time it would have been possible to build Jingu structures that survived to date.

sen.j: それを、あえて膨大な国費を投じて式年遷宮を行う途を選んだのは、当事者である神宮自身にも明確な記録はないようであるが、次の4つの理由が考えられている。
sen.e: Although Jingu seems to keep no definite records of why they dared to spend a huge amount of the nation's power to conduct Shikinen Sengu, the following four reasons are presented:
Although there are no definite records at the shrine relating to why they dared to spend a huge amount of the nation's power to conduct Shikinen Sengu, the following four reasons are given:
sen.cmt: 「Jingu seems to keep」→「there are」, 「of why」→「at the shrine relating to why」, 「presented」→「given」
sen.e: Although there are no definite records at the shrine relating to why they dared to spend a huge amount of the nation's power to conduct Shikinen Sengu, the following four reasons are given:

sen.j: 当時でも過去の建築様式である弥生建築を保つことに何らかの意義を見出していたと思われること。
sen.e: They had recognized the value of preserving Yayoi Architecture which had already been obsolete at that time.
They recognized the value of preserving Yayoi architecture which was already becoming obsolete at that time.
sen.cmt: 「had」削除, 「had already been」→「was already becoming」, I don't think a capital is required for architecture.
sen.e: They recognized the value of preserving Yayoi architecture which was already becoming obsolete at that time.

sen.j: 神道の精神として、常に新たに清浄である事を求めていること（「常若（とこわか）」という）。
sen.e: Shinto valued renewal of minds which constantly purified spirits (it is called 'Tokowaka' (forever young)).
Shinto valued the renewal of mind which constantly purified the spirit, called 'Tokowaka' (forever young).
Shinto valued the renewal of mind which constantly purified the spirit, called 'Tokowaka' (forever young).

sen.j: 即ち、建物が（使用可能であっても）老朽化することは、汚れ（気枯れ）ることであり神の生命力を衰えさせることで、そして、それらを新しくすることにより、神の生命力が蘇り活性化するという考えである。
sen.e: In other words, they thought that aged buildings meant 'kegare' (weakening) that would dissipate the vital energy endowed by the kami, so the renewal of them would also renew the energy of the kami to make us full of energy of life again.

In other words, they thought that the aging of the buildings meant that 'kegare' (weakening) would dissipate the vital energy endowed by the kami, so their reconstruction would also renew the energy of the kami to make the people full of energy again.
sen.cmt: 「aged」→「aging of the」, 「that」箇所異動,「the renewal of them」→「their reconstruction」,「us」→「the people」, 「of life」削除
sen.e: In other words, they thought that the aging of the buildings meant that 'kegare' (weakening) would dissipate the vital energy endowed by the kami, so their reconstruction would also renew the energy of the kami to make the people full of energy again.
sen.cmt: 二バイト文字を修正しました。

sen.j: 天武天皇の時代に初めて大嘗祭が行われた。
sen.e: The first Daijo-sai ceremony (the first Niiname-sai after the enthronement of an Emperor) was conducted in the period of Emperor Tenmu.
The first Daijo-sai ceremony (the first Niiname-sai ceremony after the enthronement of an Emperor) was conducted in the period of Emperor Tenmu.
The first Daijo-sai ceremony (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor) was conducted in the period of Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 大嘗祭の補足を変更しました。

sen.j: これは、天皇祭祀である毎年の新嘗祭に対する、一世一度の行事である。
sen.e: This was the major shrine ceremony conducted only once in the rein of the Emperor, compared with the annual Niiname-sai (offering of the First Fruits to the kami) by the Emperor.
This was the major shrine ceremony conducted only once in the reign of the Emperor, in contrast to the annual Niiname-sai (offering of the First Fruits to the kami) by the Emperor.
This was the major shrine ceremony conducted only once in the reign of the Emperor, in contrast to the annual Niiname-sai (offering of the First Fruits to the kami) by the Emperor.

sen.j: これに対応して毎年の神嘗祭に対する大神嘗祭として遷宮が行われるようになった。
sen.e: Corresponding to this, Jingu started Sengu as 'Okanname-sai ceremony' which was conducted in the year of culmination of annual Kanname-sai ceremony.
As a result of this, the Sengu was performed as the 'Okanname-sai ceremony' in contrast to the annual Kanname-sai ceremony.

As a result of this, the Sengu was performed as the 'Okanname-sai' (grand Kanname-sai) ceremony in contrast to the annual Kanname-sai ceremony (an offering of firstfruits of the harvest to the Ise deities by the emperor).
sen.cmt: 大神嘗祭神嘗祭→Okanname-sai (grand Kannnamesai) ceremony としました。神嘗祭→an offering of firstfruits of the harvest to the Ise deities by the emperor) と補足しました。

sen.j: 天武天皇以前には天皇が変わるごとに宮を代えていたが、恒久的な宮（藤原京）が建設されることになり、宮代わりがなくなったのでその意義を神宮の遷宮に託した。
sen.e: Each Emperor had built his own new Imperial Palace before Emperor Tenmu, who built the permanent capital (Fujiwara-kyo), but renewal of the capital ended to turn its values over to Jingu's Sengu.

Each Emperor had a new Imperial Palace built for himself prior to Emperor Tenmu, who had a permanent capital built (Fujiwara-kyo), but the values of the renewal of the capital were maintained through the Sengu of the Jingu.

Each Emperor had a new Imperial Palace built for himself prior to Emperor Tenmu, but since a permanent capital (Fujiwara-kyo) was built, the values of the renewal of the capital were maintained through the Sengu of the Jingu.
sen.cmt: 文章の構造を変更しました。

sen.j: 次に式年遷宮が20年ごとである理由としては、同じく確たる記録は無いが以下の理由が考えられている。
sen.e: Likewise, there is no definite record about why Shikinen Sengu has been conducted every 20 years, but the following reasons are presented:
Likewise, there are no definitive records as to why Shikinen Sengu has been conducted every 20 years, but the following possible reasons are given:
sen.cmt: 「is no definite record about」→「are no definitive records as to」, 「possible」挿入, 「presented」→「given」
sen.e: Likewise, there are no definitive records as to why Shikinen Sengu has been conducted every 20 years, but the following possible reasons are given:

sen.j: 建物が、上述の「清浄さ」を保つ限度が、20年程度である。
sen.e: Buildings were thought to keep their 'purity' as mentioned above for about 20 years.
As mentioned above, buildings were thought to keep their 'purity' for about 20 years.
As mentioned above, buildings were thought to keep their 'purity' for about 20 years.

sen.j: （耐用年数という意味ではない。)
sen.e: (This does not mean durable period.)
(They would of course be usable for a much longer time.)
(They would of course be usable for a much longer time.)

sen.j: 建替えの技術の伝承が、当時の寿命から適当である。
sen.e: The generation cycle to hand down the techniques of reconstruction was just about this long compared to people's lifetime in that era.
This 20-year interval was appropriate when the passing on of the techniques of reconstruction through the generations is considered.
This 20-year interval was appropriate when the passing on of the techniques of reconstruction through the generations is considered.

sen.j: （10～20代で見習い・下働き、30～40代で中堅・棟梁、50代以上は後見）
sen.e: (Workers were footmen or apprentices in teens and twenties, mid-career or master carpenters in their thirties and forties, and tutelages in their fifties.)
(Workers were footmen or apprentices in their teens and twenties, mid-career or master carpenters in their thirties and forties, and tutelages in their fifties.)
(Workers were footmen or apprentices in their teens and twenties, mid-career or master carpenters in their thirties and forties, and tutelages in their fifties.)

sen.j: 旧暦での「朔旦冬至（さくたんとうじ）」（11月1日が冬至となる）が19～20年に一度（メトン周期）である。
sen.e: In the lunar calendar, 'Sakutantoji' (the winter solstice on the1st of eleventh month) comes around once in 19 or 20 years (Metonic cycle).
In the lunar calendar, 'Sakutantoji' (the winter solstice on the 1st of the eleventh month) comes around once in 19 or 20 years (Metonic cycle).
In the lunar calendar, 'Sakutantoji' (the winter solstice on the 1st of the eleventh month) comes around once in 19 or 20 years (Metonic cycle).

sen.j: 社会・人生の区切りとして20年が適当である。
sen.e: To refresh the course of life or society every 20 years seems appropriate.
20 years can be considered an appropriate period to mark the sections of an individual's life or changes in society.
20 years can be considered an appropriate period to mark the sections of an individual's life or changes in society.

sen.j: 式年遷宮は、大神嘗祭という一面を持つが、それに使う穀物の保存年限が20年である。
sen.e: Shikinen Sengu has an aspect of Okanname-sai for which grain is used, and the shelf life of grain is 20 years.
An aspect of the Okanname-sai within the Shikinen Sengu is the use of grain, and the shelf life of grain is 20 years.
An aspect of the Okanname-sai within the Shikinen Sengu is the use of grain, and the shelf life of grain is 20 years.

sen.j: 遷宮においては、1万本以上のヒノキ材が用いられる。
sen.e: Sengu uses more than 10,000 trees of Japanese cypress.
In order to perform the Sengu more than 10,000 Japanese cypress trees are needed.
In order to perform the Sengu more than 10,000 Japanese cypress trees are needed.

sen.j: その用材を伐りだす山（御杣山･みそまやま）は、第34回式年遷宮までは、3回ほど周辺地域に移動したことはあるものの、すべて神路山・高倉山という内宮・外宮背後の山であった。
sen.e: The forest (called Miso-yama) that the timber comes from had been always Takakura-yama Mountain or Takakura-yama Mountain behind Naiku or Geku until the 34th Shikinen Sengu, with three exceptions that went to neighboring mountains.
sen.cmt: 「みそやま」は「山」ではあっても，特定の山ではなく，用材の資源地という意味(forest)であるため，"Mountain"を付加するのを避けました．
sen.e: Until the 34th Shikinen Sengu the source of the timber had always been the forest (called Miso-yama) on Takakura-yama Mountain or Kamiji-yama Mountain located behind the Naiku and Geku, with three exceptions when the trees came from neighboring mountains.

Until the thirty-fourth Shikinen Sengu the source of the timber had always been the forest (called Miso-yama) on Mt. Kamiji or Mt. Takakura located behind the Naiku (inner shrine) and Geku (outer shrine), with three exceptions when the trees came from neighboring mountains.
sen.cmt: Mt. Kamiji, Mt. Takakura, としました。内宮、外宮の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: その後、内宮用材は第35回式年遷宮から三河国に、外宮用材は第36回式年遷宮から美濃国に移り、第41回式年遷宮から第46回式年遷宮までは、伊勢国大杉谷に移った。
sen.e: After that, the timber for Naiku had come from Mikawa no Kuni since the 25th Shikinen Sengu, the timber for Geku had come from Mino no Kuni since the 36th Shiniken Sengu, and Miso-yama had been in Ise no Kuni Osugi-dani Valley since the 41st Shikinen Sengu until the 46th.

After this time, the timber for the Naiku has been taken from Mikawa no Kuni since the 35th Shikinen Sengu, and the timber for the Geku has come from Mino no Kuni since the 36th Shiniken Sengu, with the exception of Ise no Kuni Osugi-dani Valley between the 41st and 46th Shikinen Sengu.

After this time, the timber for the Naiku was taken from Mikawa Province after the 35th Shikinen Sengu, and the timber for the Geku came from Mino Province after the 36th Shikinen Sengu, with the exception of Osugi-dani Valley, Ise Province between the 41st and 46th Shikinen Sengu.
sen.cmt: Mikawa Province, Mino Province, Ise Province としました。現在は違う場所から木材を確保していることから、過去形に修正しました。

sen.j: 当該地は江戸時代において徳川御三家の一つである紀州藩の領地であった。
sen.e: This region was the territory of Kishu han which was one of Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) in Edo Period.
This region was the territory of the Kishu han which was one of the Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) in the Edo Period.
This region was the territory of the Kishu Domain which was one of the Tokugawa Gosanke (three privileged branches of the Tokugawa family) in the Edo period.

sen.j: しかしながら、原木の枯渇による伐り出しの困難さから、第47回式年遷宮から同じ御三家の尾張藩の領地である木曾谷に御杣山は移動し、以降（第51回式年遷宮のみ大杉谷に戻ったが）木曽を御杣山としている。
sen.e: However, because it became difficult to log the forest due to the depletion of raw wood in this region, Miso-yama had moved to Kiso-dani Valley which was a domain of Owari han, also one of Tokugawa Gosanke, since the 47th Shikinen Sengu, and it has stayed there ever since (it once returned to Osugi-dani Valley only for the 51st Sikinen Sengu).

However, because it became difficult to log the forest due to the depletion of raw wood in this region, Miso-yama was moved to Kiso-dani Valley which was a domain of the Owari han, also one of the Tokugawa Gosanke, after the 47th Shikinen Sengu, and it has stayed there ever since (only once returning to Osugi-dani Valley for the 51st Shikinen Sengu).
sen.cmt: 「had」削除, 「was」挿入,「the」挿入x2, 「since」→「after」, 「it once returned」→「only once returning」,「only」削除, 「Sikinen」→「Shikinen」
sen.e: However, because it became difficult to log the forest due to the depletion of raw wood in this region, Miso-yama was moved to Kiso-dani Valley which was in Owari Domain, also one of the Tokugawa Gosanke, after the 47th Shikinen Sengu, and it has stayed there ever since (only once returning to Osugi-dani Valley for the 51st Shikinen Sengu).

sen.j: 明治維新以降、尾張藩の森林は国有化され、明治時代後期から大正時代にかけて赤沢自然休養林をはじめとする地域に神宮備林が設定され、樹齢200年から300年の用材の安定提供が可能なように計画的に植林された。
sen.e: Owari han's forest was nationalized after Meiji Restoration, and Jingubirin (resource forests for Jingu) were set up in Akazawa Natural Recreation Forest and other areas during Meiji and Taisho Periods, with a systematic afforestation program making it possible to stably supply 200 to 300 year-old timber.

The forest belonging to the Owari han was nationalized after the Meiji Restoration, and Jingubirin (resource forests for the Jingu) were set up in Akazawa Natural Recreation Forest and other areas during the Meiji and Taisho Periods, with a systematic afforestation program making it possible to stably supply 200 to 300 year-old timber.
sen.cmt: 「Owari han's forest」→「The forest belonging to the Owari han」, 「the」挿入x3
sen.e: The forest belonging to the Owari Domain was nationalized after the Meiji Restoration, and Jingubirin (resource forests for the Jingu) were set up in Akazawa Natural Recreation Forest and other areas during the Meiji and Taisho periods, with a systematic afforestation program making it possible to stably supply 200 to 300 year-old timber.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後、神宮備林の指定は外されたが現在も遷宮用材の主な供給地となっている。
sen.e: They are sitill main suppliers of the timber for Sengu, although the resignation of Jingubirin was removed after the Second World War.
They are still the main suppliers of the timber for the Sengu, although the designation of Jingubirin was halted after the Second World War.
They are still the main suppliers of the timber for the Sengu, although the designation of Jingubirin was halted after the Second World War.

sen.j: 神宮では、大正12年（1923年）に森林経営計画を策定し、再び神路山・島路山・高倉山を御杣山とすべく、大正末期（1925年または1926年）から檜の植林を続けている。
sen.e: Jingu made a plan of forest management in 1923, under which they have continued planting trees of Japanese cypress since the end of Taisho Period (1925 or 1926) in an attempt to lay Miso-yama again in Kamiji-yama Mountain, Shimaji-yama Mountain, and Takakura-yama Mountain.

The Jingu made a forest management plan in 1923, after which they have continued planting Japanese cypress since the end of the Taisho Period (1925 or 1926) in an attempt to lay Miso-yama again in Kamiji-yama Mountain, Shimaji-yama Mountain, and Takakura-yama Mountain.
sen.cmt: 「The」挿入x2, 「plan of forest management」→「forest management plan」, 「under」→「after」, 「trees of」削除,
sen.e: The Jingu made a forest management plan in 1923, after which they have continued planting Japanese cypress since the end of the Taisho period (1925 or 1926) in an attempt to lay Miso-yama again in Mt. Kamiji, Mt. Shimaji, and Mt. Takakura.

sen.j: 檜の生長には200年はかかるため、本格的に使用されるのは、120年後（2125年）、また重要用材も25世紀には供給しようという遠大な計画である。
sen.e: Because Japanese cypress needs at least 200 years to grow tall enough to be logged, this is a far-reaching program that expects to start logging in 120 years (2125) and supplying main timber in the 25th century.

Because Japanese cypress needs at least 200 years to grow tall enough to be logged, this is a far-reaching program where logging is expected to begin in 120 years (2125) and for it to be the main source of timber only in the 25th century.
sen.cmt: 「that expects to start logging」→「where logging is expected to begin」, 「supplying main timber」→「for it to be the main source of timber only」
sen.e: Because Japanese cypress needs at least 200 years to grow tall enough to be logged, this is a far-reaching program where logging is expected to begin in 120 years (2125) and for it to be the main source of timber only in the 25th century.

sen.j: ただし、第62回では間伐材をそれなりの用途で使用し、全用材の25%を賄う。
sen.e: However, they plan to use thinned wood for various parts covering 25% of the total timber wood for the 62nd Sengu.
However, they plan to use thinned wood for various parts covering 25% of the total for the 62nd Sengu.
However, they plan to use thinned wood for various parts covering twenty-five percent of the total for the sixty-second Sengu.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 旧殿に使用された用材は神宮内や摂社・末社をはじめ全国の神社の造営等に再利用される。
sen.e: The materials used for the old buildings will be recycled to build or repair Sessha and Massha (affiliated sub-shrines) inside Jingu and other shrines across the country.

sen.j: 宮川河原から採集した「お白石」を御木曳同様に陸曳・川曳で運び、正殿用地に敷き詰める行事。
sen.e: They carry "Oshiraishi"(white pebbles), which has been took from the riverside of Miya-gawa River, by Okabiki and Kawabiki like Okihikigyoji to place on the sacred grounds.

Brought by Okabiki and Kawabiki in the same way as the Okihikigyoji, participants carry "Oshiraishi"(white pebbles) which have been taken from the riverside at Miya-gawa River, in order to place them in the sacred grounds.
